sentences.sContent: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.sCn: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.sContent: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.sCn: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.sContent: ...children begin to define subjects and erect boundaries that needn't other-wise exist...

synos.tran: 竖立的；笔直的；因性刺激而勃起的

remMethod.val: e ＋ rect(竖， 直) → 竖直的， 挺直的

trans.tranOther: to build something such as a building or wall
